 **Position Overview:** Join our dynamic outpatient clinic in Oceanport, NJ, where you will provide both direct and indirect nursing care to a geriatric population. This role offers a Monday to Friday-schedule with no weekends, ensuring a great work-life balance! You will work under the supervision of the Clinical Services Supervisor, utilizing advanced nursing knowledge to manage complex clinical situations effectively.

**Setting:** Outpatient Clinic working with the geriatric population, with occasional home visitations as needed.

**Responsibilities:**

* Collect and accurately document patient data.
* Identify patient needs and prioritize care accordingly.
* Observe and record diagnostic results, performing advanced nursing assessments.
* Develop and update care plans with input from patients and families.
* Be present during medical services, ensuring care meets nursing and organizational standards.
* Administer treatments and procedures, educate patients and families, and coordinate care with healthcare personnel.
* Integrate cost-effective measures into practice and actively participate in quality improvement processes.
* Adjust staffing based on patient care needs and comply with safety policies.
* Perform other duties as assigned.

**Qualifications:**

* Previous experience of RN clinical experience within the last 3 years.
* Current Registered Nurse (RN) license in the state of SC.
* Associate or Bachelor's degree in Nursing (BSN preferred).
* BLS from the American Heart Association.
* Reliable transportation, valid driver's license, and required auto insurance.
* Experience in geriatrics, home health, or a similar setting preferred.

**Benefits:**

* Flexible pay (ask me!)
* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Opportunity to work with a dynamic and growing organization.
* Monday - Friday, no weekends.

 **Join Our Team!** If you're ready to make a difference and thrive in a dynamic outpatient clinic, we want to hear from you! Please **APPLY** or directly email your resume to suraj@teemasupport.com. You can also call/text (925) 290-7974. I strive to reply within 1 - 2 hours. Looking forward to connecting with you soon. Thank you!

title: Analyst, Marketing Planning & Analytics
description:
*Disney+ is the dedicated streaming home for movies and shows from Disney, Pixar, Marvel, Star Wars, and National Geographic, along with The Simpsons and much more! In select international markets, it also includes the general entertainment content brand, Star. The flagship direct-to-consumer streaming service from The Walt Disney Company, Disney+ offers an ever-growing collection of exclusive originals, including feature-length films, documentaries, live-action and animated series, and short-form content. With unprecedented access to Disney’s long history of incredible film and television entertainment, Disney+ is also the exclusive streaming home for the newest releases from The Walt Disney Studios!*

*Disney+ is available as a standalone streaming service, as part of the Disney Bundle in the U.S. that gives subscribers access to Disney+, Hulu, and ESPN+, or as part of Combo+ in Latin America with Star+, the standalone general entertainment and sports streaming service in the region. For more, visit disneyplus.com, or find the Disney+ app on most mobile and connected TV devices.*


The Growth Marketing team is tasked with driving new subscriber acquisition & Disney Streaming’s profitability business objectives for Disney+ and The Disney Bundle. The team is responsible for the planning, execution, and optimization of user acquisition and performance marketing campaigns. The ideal candidate has a passion for the digital media landscape and understands the intricacies and unique attributes of every step in the marketing funnel.

**Responsibilities:**
---------------------

* Assist with orchestrating the development of reporting and analysis, specifically integrating marketing data with content + retention metrics.
* Develop and maintain reporting dashboards using Tableau, Looker and sophisticated Excel to track key marketing critical metrics.
* Craft and develop clear, visually engaging charts and infographics to effectively communicate sophisticated data, trends, and insights
* Support implementation and management of automated solutions to streamline data collection, transformation, and reporting workflows, reducing manual effort, minimizing errors, and accelerating the delivery of accurate, actionable insights
* Execute in-depth, targeted, ad-hoc data analyses to support partner needs across marketing, finance, and data teams
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities for optimization and improvement.
* Use detailed, comprehensive data analysis to assist the creation and implementation of marketing and content strategies.
* Assist with analyzing customer centricity (identifying customer characteristics and marketing platforms that result in higher retention and up-sell opportunities).
* Stay current with industry trends and competitor’s best practices in marketing analytics and content planning.

**Basic Requirements:**
-----------------------

* Bachelor's degree
* 3+ years of professional experience in marketing analytics or a data related field.
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret sophisticated data sets.
* Proficiency in data analysis and reporting tools such as SQL, Tableau, Looker.
* Advance excel knowledge (sumifs, index-match, macros)
* Excellent communication and presentation skills.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
* Meticulous with a high level of accuracy

**Preferred Requirements:**
---------------------------

* Prior experience in marketing analytics or working with a streaming service
* Experience working with digital marketing organizations
* Experiencing working with Marketing Mix Models
* Programming knowledge in Python, R or SQL

  


The hiring range for this position in New York, NY is $89,300.00 to $119,700.00 per year. The base pay actually offered will take into account internal equity and also may vary depending on the candidate’s geographic region, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. A bonus and/or long-term incentive units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to the full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the level and position offered.

title: Visual Designer
description:
Disney+ is the dedicated streaming home for movies and shows from Disney, Pixar, Marvel, Star Wars, and National Geographic, along with The Simpsons and much more. In select international markets, it also includes the general entertainment content brand, Star. The flagship direct-to-consumer streaming service from The Walt Disney Company, Disney+ offers an ever-growing collection of exclusive originals, including feature-length films, documentaries, live-action and animated series, and short-form content. With unprecedented access to Disney’s long history of incredible film and television entertainment, Disney+ is also the exclusive streaming home for the newest releases from The Walt Disney Studios. Disney+ is available as a standalone streaming service, as part of the Disney Bundle in the U.S. that gives subscribers access to Disney+, Hulu, and ESPN+, or as part of Combo+ in Latin America with Star+, the standalone general entertainment and sports streaming service in the region. For more, visit disneyplus.com, or find the Disney+ app on most mobile and connected TV devices.


The Growth Marketing team is tasked with driving new subscriber acquisition & driving Disney Streaming’s profitability business objectives for Disney+ and The Disney Bundle. The team is responsible for the planning, execution, and optimization of user acquisition and performance marketing campaigns. The ideal candidate has a passion for the digital media landscape and understands the intricacies and unique attributes of every step in the marketing funnel.


As the **Visual Designer**, you will be responsible for creating and supporting the delivery of designs and ad placements for digital growth marketing and retention campaigns. Our campaigns come in many formats such as rich media display ads, marketing landing page components, animation/motion graphics, social media posts, marketing emails and more. Graphic Designers focus on production and layout design, across digital platforms, contributing to group projects and working independently depending on tasks and campaign needs. You will work with Art Directors, Sr. Visual Designers, Copywriters, Motion Graphics Designers and other marketing teams to make our campaigns come to life.


We are looking for candidates that are self-starters, have strong conceptualization skills, and passion for design, advertising and creative marketing. If you are a passionate designer and excited about joining a multi-disciplinary creative team, pushing the boundaries of entertainment marketing, we want to hear from you!


Along with your application, **please submit a portfolio or links to your published work**. Your portfolio must reflect fundamental graphic design skills with understanding of message hierarchy, typographic layout and pixel perfect Photoshop compositing. If a password is required to access your portfolio, please be sure to include it as well.

**Responsibilities:**

* Support Creative/Art Directors with the production of digital marketing assets
* Versioning of creative assets for global marketing campaigns
* Contribute to the conceptualization of campaign concepts/use of artwork
* Design visual solutions for social media assets
* Support design and implementation of campaign and weekly marketing emails

**Basic Qualifications:**

* A portfolio reflecting precise fundamental graphic design skills with understanding of message hierarchy, typographic layout and pixel perfect Photoshop compositing.
* 2+ years of experience in a design or comparable role
* BA/BFA in Graphic Design, a comparable certification, or equivalent experience required
* Experience staying up to date on new design and creative technologies, industry trends and innovation
* Passion for team culture initiatives
* Strong time management skills with the ability to multitask and meet deadlines
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Expert Adobe Creative Suite abilities, including Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign as well as Sketch, HTML and CSS, Figma

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Experience working on film/entertainment, sports, lifestyle brands are a plus

  

The hiring range for this position in New York is $80,800 to $108,300 per year. The base pay actually offered will take into account internal equity and also may vary depending on the candidate’s geographic region, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. A bonus and/or long-term incentive units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to the full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the level and position offered.

title: Specialist, Ad Operations
description:
The Specialist, Ad Operations will play a critical role in managing all executional aspects of paid media campaigns pertaining to tagging, tracking, audience verification, data capture strategy, and overall media technology, to ensure the timely launch and proper execution of advertising campaigns. The ideal candidate has a passion for the digital media landscape, possesses excellent communication skills, and has the ability to ideate and collaborate across teams.


Responsibilities:

* Act as liaison with paid media teams, creative teams, and publisher partners regarding planning, tracking, scheduling and delivery of campaigns
* Work closely with manager to serve as a point of contact between ad server and internal business units
* Support all media trafficking needs by scheduling and maintaining placements, rotation of ads, and creative throughout the lifetime of campaigns
* Efficiently distribute tags, trackers, and creative assets to all media partners
* Embed additional survey, audience measurement, verification, and other tracking components for external vendors as needed
* Support daily QA and timely troubleshooting of all placements, tagging, and floodlights/vendor pixels for on-site tracking implementations to ensure proper tracking
* Educate and assist internal/external teams on proper implementation and best practices of third-party ad serving tags and systems
* Proactively communicate with all internal teams (paid media, analytics, creative, etc.) at the onset of a campaign to identify and implement all creative and technical requirements
* Comfortable working in a fast-paced and dynamic working environment, supporting new products/businesses supported by a proven large-scale media property


Basic Requirements:

* 2+ years ad operations experience either agency side or within the digital industry (inclusive of DSPs, ad serving companies, etc.), trafficking large-scale paid media campaigns
* Experience with direct response campaigns Hands on experience with DoubleClick Campaign Manager third-party ad serving
* Flexibility & ability to work in a fast paced and dynamic environment
* A strong communicator with a can-do, positive attitude and a strong desire to get things done
* Sense of humor and desire to have fun!


Preferred Requirements:

* Experience with Mobile App Tracking solutions preferred: Kochava, Appsflyer, Adjust, etc.
* Experience with rich media solutions preferred: DoubleClick RM, Flashtalking, Sizmek, etc.
* Experience with third-party ad verification partners preferred: Integral Ad Science, Doubleverify, etc.


Basic Education:

* Bachelor’s degree in marketing or related field; or equivalent practical experience

  


The hiring range for this position in New York is $80,770.00 to $108,350.00 per year. The base pay actually offered will take into account internal equity and also may vary depending on the candidate’s geographic region, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. title: Utilities Technician
description:
Union Beverage Company is currently seeking a **Utilities Technician** who will be responsible for performing preventive scheduled and unscheduled maintenance activities, troubleshooting and diagnosing problems with plant support equipment, and maintaining records of such activities. The successful candidate will work with the maintenance manager to quickly diagnose problems and prevent downtime.

**Responsibilities:**

· Perform preventive maintenance and corrective maintenance adhering to standard cGMP, GEP procedures, and safety regulations.

· Direct and perform mechanical and preventive maintenance as well as major repairs on all facility equipment.

· Solve complex mechanical and electrical system problems.

· Coordinate inspections and testing of machinery and equipment to detect malfunctions.

· Schedule and coordinate wall releases, repairs, and installation of cable outlets and services, plastering, painting, and other complex building projects.

· Supporting the tasks of the Utility Supervisor in planning, assessing, maintaining, and implementing improvements/innovations to ensure the reliability of utility supply infrastructure used by standard rules, including GMP, safety regulations, and compliance regulations.

· Supporting project management for facility-related projects, including but not limited to building renovations and construction, equipment installation and/or placement, safety and environmental compliance, mechanical system maintenance, and energy conservation.

· Support maintenance performance assessment and continuous improvement implementation.

· Improve skills and knowledge to operate, repair, and maintain utility machinery.

· Speak up about improvements, maintenance cost efficiency, spare parts efficiency.

· Oversee the dismantling of damaged machinery and equipment and the installation of new or repaired parts.

· Coordinate and ensure maintenance logs, spare parts requests, preventive maintenance inspection records, and other necessary maintenance documentation.

· Promote all safety, environmental, and energy management systems.

· Lead and supervise other mechanical work.

· Install and maintain piping systems and related hydraulic and pneumatic equipment, as well as repair and replace gauges, valves, pressure regulators, and related equipment.

· Value Added to the success of the company.

· Play a role in ensuring the reliability of utility infrastructure through maintenance, repairs, and innovations to support smooth production in meeting product supply requirements.

**Required Skills and Experience:**

· Possesses knowledge of Utility machinery, equipment, or apparatus (Compressed Air, Boiler, Power House), WTP (including Purified Water), WWTP, and HVAC.

· Has knowledge and experience in Preventive and Predictive Maintenance, especially for Utility machinery, equipment, or apparatus.

· Proficient and systematic in troubleshooting machinery, equipment, or apparatus within the Utility scope.

· Willing to work on a shift schedule or based on emergency on-call duty outside regular working hours.

· Able to work effectively within a team.

· Possesses conflict resolution and ambiguity-handling skills.

· Experience in the food/beverage industry.

· Previous Experience in Manufacturing or Production Environment.

**Physical Requirements and Working Conditions:**

* Ability to exert up to 100 lbs. of force occasionally, and/or up to 50 lbs. of force frequently, and/or up to 25 lbs. of force constantly to move objects.
* Must be able to lift 75 to 100 pounds occasionally.
* Exposure to loud noises in our production facility.

Education:

* Associate (Required)

Experience:

* Manufacturing: 2 years (Required)
* Maintenance: 2 years (Required)

Shift availability:

* Day Shift (Required)
* Night Shift (Required)
* Overnight Shift (Required)

Work Location: In person

NOTE: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.

title: Quality Inspector
description:
Major Manufacturing company is looking for a Quality Inspector. The Quality Inspector checks the quality of incoming and outgoing products by conducting tests, monitoring production processes, and identifying non-conforming material. They work in various manufacturing and production settings, such as the quality control department, manufacturing floor and laboratories.

**RESPONSIBILTIES**

* Roving Inspection
* Use of inspection equipment
* Determining status of actively running product (ACC / REJ)
* Interaction with production operators / supervisors.
* Reads blueprints and specifications.
* Monitor operations to ensure that they meet production standards.
* Impact, test or measure materials or products being produced.
* Measure products with calipers, micrometers, or gauges.
* Operate electronic inspection equipment such as coordinate-measuring machines (CMMs) and vision systems.
* Approve or reject raw materials or finished products with respect to quality standards and record supplier performance.
* Remove all products and materials that fail to meet specifications.
* Report inspection and test data such as dimensions, hardness, weights, grades, and quantities inspected.
* Prepare and submit reports to the Quality Manager.
* Assists production personnel in promoting ideas fore controlling wasted materials and time.
* Light Lifting
* Completing any other tasks assigned by the Quality manager.

**QUALITIFICATIONS AND SKILLS**

* High School diploma or equivalent is required
* Quality Control certifications a plus
* A keen eye for detail and a results-driven approach
* Good computer skills
* Good basic math knowledge and excellent attention to details
* English a must
* Reports to the Quality Assurance Manager
* Compensation dependent of experience and qualifications

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Preferred)

Experience:

* Manufacturing: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Preparador
description:
SA Hospitality Group es italiano de corazón, la visión de Gherardo Guarducci y Dimitri Pauli, quienes han traducido las sensibilidades del viejo mundo para atraer a la clientela moderna de la ciudad de Nueva York. Desde 2003, SA Hospitality Group se ha expandido a un grupo selecto de barrios icónicos de Nueva York con sus tres marcas: Sant Ambroeus, Casa Lever, Felice con 24 restaurantes en Manhattan, Southampton, NY, East Hampton, NY, Aspen, CO, Milán, Italia y Palm Beach, FL.
  
  

**Propósito de la Posición:** esta persona es responsable de preparar y configurar las estaciones de trabajo y los ingredientes para que los alimentos se puedan preparar de acuerdo con las recetas.
  
  

**Responsabilidades Esenciales:**  

* Siga las recetas, el control de las porciones y las especificaciones de presentación utilizando varios utensilios y equipos de cocina.
* Asegurar la calidad y precisión de los ingredientes y platos de acuerdo con los estándares de la marca.
* Adquirir el conocimiento para operar equipos de cocción y fabricación de pasta.
* Configure su estación con todos los ingredientes, preparación y utensilios necesarios al inicio y al final del servicio
* Reabastezca todos los artículos según sea necesario durante el turno.
* Inspeccione las áreas de preparación y servicio de alimentos para garantizar el cumplimiento de prácticas sanitarias y seguras de manipulación de alimentos.
* Voltee o revuelva los alimentos para asegurar una cocción uniforme.
* Sazone y cocine los alimentos de acuerdo con las recetas o el juicio y la experiencia personal.
* Observe / pruebe los alimentos para determinar si están lo suficientemente cocidos al probarlos, olerlos o perforarlos con utensilios.
* Divida, organice y decore la comida y sirva la comida al personal o los clientes.
* Sustituir o ayudar a otros cocineros durante emergencias o períodos pico.
* Desempeñar responsabilidades adicionales según lo solicite el chef, el segundo chef o el gerente de cocina en cualquier momento.
* Limpiar y mantener la estación mientras practica habilidades excepcionales de seguridad, saneamiento y organización.
* Comprender y demostrar el uso y mantenimiento adecuados de todo el equipo de cocina.
* Ayudar con la limpieza, el saneamiento y la organización de la cocina, las cámaras frigoríficas y todas las áreas de almacenamiento.
* Recibir y organizar las entregas asegurando el recuento y el peso de las facturas para mantener los costos.
* Constantemente expuesto a fuentes de calor para preparar comidas.
* Mantenga siempre un comportamiento profesional con todo el personal.
* Notifique al Gerente General o al Chef si hay escasez de ingredientes, utensilios o artículos sanitarios.
* Notifique al Gerente General o al Chef si hay alguna actividad de plagas.
* Mantenga las áreas de trabajo de la cocina, el equipo y los utensilios en condiciones limpias y ordenadas.
* Limpie y prepare varios alimentos para cocinar o servir si el chef se lo pide


**Requisitos Esenciales Mínimos:**  

* La habilidad de trabajar como parte de un equipo
* Habilidad para comunicarse y comprender instrucciones en ingles para garantizar la seguridad en el lugar de trabajo. Capacidad para comprender, responder y interactiar con compañeros de trabajo, gerentes y invitados en ingles.
* Conocimiento básico de preparación de comida, experiencia en limpieza es bienvenida
* Habilidad de manejar el tiempo y capaz de trabajar bajo presión y manejar altos volúmenes de producción
* Habilidades de escuchar y aprender activamente
* Habilidades de comprensión de lectura y hablado
* Disciplina para seguir direcciones y estándares establecidos
* Habilidad de levantar hasta 30 lbs


**ADA:** SA Hospitality Group hará las acomodaciones necesarias en conformidad con el Acta de Americanos con Discapacidades de 1990 (Americans with Disabilities Act -ADA).
  
  

Esta descripción de trabajo será revisada periódicamente a medida que las responsabilidades y requisitos cambien con la necesidad del negocio. Funciones laborales esenciales y marginales están sujetas a cambios.

title: Sales - Wireless Specialist
description:
Why Russell Cellular?
  
  

Starting pay is up to $21/hr!
  
* Health, dental, vision, and life insurance
* Paid sick days and company holidays
* Employer matched 401K
* Listed in Inc. 5000's Fastest Growing Private Companies in America for 9 consecutive years and inducted into the Inc. Hall of Fame in 2018
* Employee Assistance Programs
* 750+ locations in 43 states employing 2,600+ employees
* Verizon Sales discounts, sales contests and incentives
* Opportunity for growth and advancement
* Flexible scheduling
* Community involvement opportunities
* Same-day pay options
* Amazing company cultures


What will you do in your role?
  
  

You will get to know your customers and to discover their needs. You will provide them with individualized customer service in order to equip them with the wireless products and services they need. As a Retail Sales Representative, you will practice Russell Cellular’s core values of Integrity, Expertise, Initiative and Service and will live out our brand foundation of Care for Every Person with your team, customers and members of the communities in which we do business. If you're self-motivated and interested in a career in retail sales, if you are looking for an opportunity for growth and financial stability, then you need to consider being a Wireless Specialist for Russell Cellular, a Verizon Authorized Retailer.
  
  

**Duties & Responsibilities include:**  

* Facilitate retail sales of cellular phones, tablets, watches and other devices along with wireless services to the general public while demonstrating outstanding customer service
* Create additional sales opportunities through creative marketing campaigns in cooperation with the Marketing Department and community involvement events
* Develop continuous and up-to-date knowledge of Russell Cellular and wireless products and services; demonstrate equipment capabilities
* Handle daily store operations such as opening/closing, inventory control, cash management, and various office/administrative duties
* Develop and monitor action plans for the accomplishment of daily/month sales goals


Job requirements
  
* High School Diploma or GED
* Strong interpersonal, verbal, and communication skills; ability to build relationships and adapt to a diverse customer base is desired
* Motivation and an inner drive to learn, grow, and excel
* A knack for technology and the ability to learn wireless quickly
* Ability to work nights, weekends, and holidays as need be

title: Assistant Teacher
description:
**Assistant Teacher**

Family Services of Westchester (FSW) provides mental health and social services that strengthen and support families, children and individuals at every stage of their lives. With 50 innovative programs, FSW serves 30,000 individuals annually in Westchester County, New York, here to create hope, restore dignity and connect families with the resources to get back on track.

Founded in 1954, Family Services of Westchester is a private, nonprofit, non-sectarian social services agency.

FSW’s Head Start/Early Head Start is a federal government program that was created in 1965 to give preschool children from low-income families a “head start” on their readiness for elementary school.

**\\*\\*Effective May 1st, 2024 – May 31st, 2024, we will be offering a sign on bonus of $1,000 to all Lead Teachers and $500 to all Assistant Teachers who apply within the specified window of time.**

**This sign on bonus will align with FSW’s outlined procedure, as well as be agreed upon between both the applicant and HR upon time of hire.\\*\\***

**Job Details:**

Family Services of Westchester is looking for **full-time Assistant Teachers** for our **Head Start** program. We are hiring for multiple locations throughout Westchester County.

**POSITION TITLE**: Assistant Teacher  
**SALARY:** *$16.75/hour*  
**STATUS**: Permanent/Full Time  
**SUPERVISED BY**: Head Teacher  
**PURPOSE**: To assist and support the Head Teacher to interpret and implement the Head Start & Early Head Start programs to address the needs of each individual child.  
**WORK LOCATION:** One Location

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES**:

* Ensure health and safety guidelines for children.
* Assist lead teacher in the documentation, reflection and planning process to implement the curriculum.
* Attend staff training to support professional development.
* Build relationships with families and communicate about children's learning and development.
* Assist with creating a warm and inclusive environment for children and families.
* Assist with creating visual evidence of the narratives and curriculum occurring in your classroom.
* Other tasks as assigned by supervisor and Head Teacher.

**MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS**:

* CDA or Associate’s Degree in Early Childhood Education or related field, English fluency.

**PERFORMANCE CRITERIA**: Performance will be evaluated based on:

* Continuing to pursue education in the Early Childhood field.
* Performance and Goals
* Seniority.

**Ability to Commute/Relocate:**

* White Plains, NY 10603: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

**Experience**:

* Childcare: 1 year (Preferred)

**Bonus opportunities for eligible Lead Teachers and Assistant Teachers, based on performance and employment status.**

There are a variety of benefits to joining Family Services of Westchester, an organization with over 65 years of history impacting vulnerable communities. In addition to the opportunity to connect with and help thousands of residents in Westchester County, FSW offers its employees an inspiring, diverse and team-based work environment with comprehensive benefits including medical, dental, life insurance, flexible spending accounts, and 403(b) for full-time employees.

At FSW, we enjoy working in a collaborative, mission-driven environment and value the benefits of a diversified workplace that prioritizes our clients and the communities we serve. If you want to make a difference in the lives of thousands of people across the communities of Westchester, and if the position of Assistant Teacher speaks to your capabilities, experience and commitment to social service, please submit your resume and cover letter. Qualified candidates will be contacted by phone and/or email.

*FSW is an equal opportunity employer.*

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $16.75 - $17.28 per hour

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person
company_description: FSW is a nonprofit organization providing Westchester County with a vast range of social and mental health services that strengthen and support individuals at every stage of the life cycle.

title: Account Executive
description:
**Account Executive**

**Location: Jersey City (Hybrid)**

In this position, you’ll be based in the Jersey City office for a minimum of three days a week, with the flexibility to work from home for some of your working week. Find out more about our flexible work culture at computershare.com/flex.  



**We give you a world of potential**

Georgeson's unclaimed property services cover the unclaimed property lifecycle, relieving organizations of complex and resource intensive tasks. The Asset Reunification division within Georgeson is responsible for providing PostMerger CleanUp, Shareholder CleanUp, Unclaimed Asset Programs, and other solutions to Issuer Services clients and their shareholders.  



**A role you will love**

The Account Executive is responsible for the day-to-day delivery of expert level client service to Asset Reunification clients and their shareholders ensuring the efficient and profitable management of their Asset Reunification programs. The Account Executive works closely with internal stakeholders including Relationship Management, Global Core Operations, CCS, CTS, and external stakeholders including Issuer clients and external transfer agents ensuring the programs’ success.


Additionally, the Account Executive will support efforts to gain new business by acting as a subject matter expert for the Sales team, and in advising the Relationship Management team on how to pursue cross-sell and upsell opportunities.  



**Key Responsibilities**

* Manage programs by disseminating accurate and complete information, developing strategies to ensure financial success by communicating program status and progress to stakeholders.
* Work with internal and external stakeholders to resolve complex day-to-day issues and direct them to appropriate resources to ensure a timely and correct resolution is reached.
* Establish and maintain positive working relationships with clients, Relationship Managers, and other internal stakeholders to drive business growth.
* Forecast future financial results from active programs to identify shortfalls, help guide strategic plans for future financial periods, and ensure cost efficiency.
* Lead the development of process improvements.
Support sales efforts by authoring program literature and sales collateral, acting as a subject matter export to achieve and exceed sales forecasts and targets.  
* 

**What will you bring to the role?**

* Experience operating within defined technical and operational procedures.
* Excellent stakeholder management skills and experience working in a client facing position.
* Previous experience working as a Project Manager would be desirable.
* Organised approach to work.
Background in Financial services would be beneficial.  
* 

**Rewards designed for you**

**Paid parental leave** , flexible working and a caring and inclusive culture.


**Health and wellbeing** rewards that can be tailored to support you and your family, including medical, dental and vision.


**Invest in your future** with 401k matching and tax-advantaged flexible spending plans, including healthcare, dependent care and commuter.


**Income protection** . Our package includes short and long-term disability benefits, life insurance and supplemental life insurance.


**And more.** Ours is a welcoming and close-knit community, with experienced colleagues ready to help you grow. Our handbook will help you find out more about our rewards and life at Computershare, visit computershare.com/careers-handbook.


**Compensation.** T he typical base pay range for this role is $70,000 - $84,000. This range reflects our good faith effort to pay fairly based on our job evaluation of this role and we tailor our offers within the range based on the selected candidate’s relevant knowledge, skills, experience, and other job-related factors.
company_description: If you're looking for a career journey in financial services, we give you a world of potential.

title: Construction Project Coordinator
description:
Old World Craftsmen LLC, a design-build & residential remodeling company is seeking a highly motivated candidate looking for a growth position as a lead role in managing and executing high end renovations in lower Westchester & Connecticut. Old World Craftsmen has been in business for 25 years, focusing on a teamwork approach to delivering impeccable service and craftsmanship from concept to completion. Looking for a candidate who enjoys varied daily work, and wants to be the owner’s “right hand” in running and improving a successful business with integrity. Profit sharing after proven performance.

Be the owner’s right hand in managing high end residential remodel projects:

* Assist in managing construction projects including client communication & follow up
* Work as a team with the owner on pricing and drafting of proposals
* Management and Tracking of change orders
* Assist with materials procurement and coordination of job site deliveries
* Assist with job & subcontractor scheduling, facilitating subcontractor site entry
* Building permit and Cert. of Occupancy procurement, licensing requirements
* Schedule & coordinate inspections; at times meet inspectors
* Scheduling of site meetings & video conferences
* Site visits as required to maintain contact with job site activities
* Stock construction material inventory management
* Monitor daily backup, troubleshoot minor computer issues, coordinate computer support

Support our business, clients, outsourced A/P and payroll company in the business finances:

* Monitor milestones to trigger invoicing and subcontractor payments
* Job analysis for profitability
* Workers Comp and Liability Insurance tracking and certificates
* Responding to client calls/requests, provide reports and explanations to resolve billing issues
* Maintain office records, supplies & annual insurance policies
* Review and send timesheets to outsourced payroll and update Quickbooks biweekly
* Work together with outsourced accounts payable team handling: vendor installment payments, bill payment and reconciliation

**Qualifications:**

* Construction project management skills
* Independent time management and understands priorities and deadlines
* Driven to look for cost savings and improvement in profitability
* Excellent task tracking and independent follow up habits
* Excellent oral & written communication skills
* Demonstrated high level of inter-personal skills and the ability to communicate and deal with vendors & top level customers
* Must be accurate and detail oriented
* Able to multi-task and problem solve

**Software Skills:**

* Exposure to small business finance & experience with Quickbooks
* Proficient with computers: touch type and confident & proficient in Microsoft Word, Outlook, Windows, Excel

**Benefits & Compensation:**

* Base Salary Range $70,000-$80,000 based on relevant experience
* Owner's Commitment to Work-Life Balance
* Profit Sharing Compensation for the right candidate after a vesting period
* Positive, teamwork focused work environment
* Full time work with Holidays, Vacation & Bonus Available

Veterans Welcome

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $70,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Warehouse Package Handler
description:
We are hiring Warehouse Workers / Package Handlers for our Harriman, NY location.
  
  

Applying is quick and easy – talk to a recruiter today and you could start within the week!
  
  

**Address:** 2 Commerce Dr South, Harriman, NY, 10962
  
  

**Shift:** Tuesday through Friday 1:00am - End of Sort and Sunday 12am - End of Sort. “End of Sort” is defined as the completion of all required sort work for the day and clean-up activities, as directed by site management.
  
  

How you will be rewarded as a Warehouse Worker / Package Handler :
  
* Hourly Rate starting at $17.50/hr (weekly pay)
* Great Benefits Package including Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance
* 401(k) with Employer Match


**As a Warehouse Worker / Package Handler, we count on you to :**  

* Be Safe! Safety is our first core value.
* Unload trailers and sort packages by zip codes
* Load trucks for deliveries
* Be a team player – everyone works together to get the job done!


**Skills you need :**  

* Ability to stay on your feet while working - this is a great job for someone looking to stay active!
* Ability to be dependable, flexible, and reliable
* Ability to lift up to 50 pounds
* Ability to work in the heat and the cold as temperatures vary in the warehouse by season
* Gloves and work boots are recommended


Referral Program
  
* Referral bonus reward of $500 (offered for all positions company-wide)
* Payout: $250 will be paid on the next paycheck after the 45-day mark for the referred candidate’s tenure, and $250 will be paid on the next paycheck after the 90-day mark for the referred candidate’s tenure.
* Dates of the $500 referral bonus eligibility will be for referrals that start between 04/1/2024 and 10/31/2024.
* Please note that candidates must indicate on their application in Ceridian Dayforce, the full name of the person who referred them with the location.


OnTrac is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer
  
OnTrac is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, abilities, and experiences. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or age. Join us in our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. If you are excited to be part of our team and contribute to our talent acquisition efforts, we invite you to apply.

title: NJ Resident Care Aide / HHA – Full-Time
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You'll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You'll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal "hospitality with a higher purpose." We know you'll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


We are seeking compassionate and dedicated **Resident Care Assistants/Home Health Aides** with a skillset and a heart for helping residents make the most of each day. In this position, you'll be a friendly and familiar face to our residents, providing hands-on care in a respectful and dignified manner. Your role is essential to the care and safety of residents who choose to call The Bristal home. The loving care you bring to the services you provide is fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.


Additional responsibilities include:

* Assisting residents manage Activities of Daily Living (ADLs)
* Escorting residents to meals and recreational activities
* Supporting residents in achieving their highest level of physical, emotional and psycho-social well-being
* Helping out as needed in the Wellness area to ensure the safety, comfort and wellbeing of our residents
* Following all policies and procedures, and adhering to the instructions of the Nurse Shift Supervisor and the Director of Wellness

**Full-time schedule includes one weekend shift per week (Tues–Sat or Sun–Thurs).**

**Qualifications:**

* NJ-Certified Nursing Assistant or Home Health Aide
* Experience assisting those with Alzheimer's disease and dementia is a plus
* Must be able to speak and read in English
* Previous experience with geriatric population preferred, providing assistance with ADLs
* Ability to follow instructions and establish personal care routines
* Basic understanding of dementia; patience and professionalism in redirecting residents
* Ability to adjust to different personality types and situations in positive ways
* Must always be reliable, caring and gentle in touch and demeanor
* Maintain an abiding respect for the elderly and remain calm at all times
company_description: The Bristal Assisted Living is the premier in senior living with 24 locations throughout the tri-state area inlcuding Long Island, Westchester, Manhattan, and New Jersey.

You know the satisfied feeling you get at an upscale restaurant when the servers do an excellent job? That's the same feeling we wish our residents to have every day, and as part of our Waitstaff team, your performance is key to making that happen. title: Lifestyle Coordinator – Full-Time
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You'll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You'll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal "hospitality with a higher purpose." We know you'll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


We are seeking a creative, compassionate, hands-on **Recreation Activities Assistant** to assist in presenting and coordinating recreational programs for our assisted living residents, as well as residents with Alzheimer's disease or dementia in our dedicated Reflections Memory Care Neighborhood. You will assist residents in making the adjustment to a new concept of living at our luxury assisted living community, not only encouraging them to continue pursuing their interests, hobbies and lifestyle activities, but also to develop new and stimulating interests, as well. You will help plan fun and safe trips to suitable destinations, such as art galleries, theaters, music venues, racetracks, sports events as well as religious and cultural programs. You will also help prepare, print and distribute copies of our monthly calendar, newsletters and memos to residents. You will also be expected to perform planned activities in the absence of the Director of Recreation. In this role you will maintain a knowledge of resident backgrounds, hobbies, special interests, and spoken languages, etc., and use this knowledge to encourage resident engagement and participation. The loving attention you bring to the assistance you provide is fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.


Full Time, Part Time, and Per Diem schedules available


The ideal candidate will have the following skills/qualifications:

* One year's prior experience working with a senior population, and those with Alzheimer's disease and dementia a plus
* At least 6 months of Recreation activity experience (art therapy, music therapy) or event leadership experience, and preferably in assisted living, long-term care or a similar industry setting
* Be outgoing, warm and have a genuine caring personality
* Able to create programs that get residents involved and excited
* Be dependable and able to supervise activities, special events and safe excursions for the residents
* Has creative talents in one or more areas, such as art, music, readings, dance, etc.
* Always maintaining oneself well-groomed and properly attired
* Demonstrates good listening and communication skills and always presents a positive spirit and professional attitude
* Possesses a proven ability to lead classes and other instructional learning sessions and speak in front of a group setting with ease, confidence and clarity
* Holds a high school diploma or equivalent at a minimum

**Must have or be willing to get a COVID-19 vaccine, subject to legal accommodations**

title: Future* Sales & Design Consultant
description:
***About Pratesi***

In 1896, a young wine merchant named Remigio Pratesi fell in love with a beautiful woman in his village outside of Florence. In hopes of wooing her, Remigio commissioned an exquisite set of linens handwoven by local seamstresses.

By 1906, the local nobility sought his hand-crafted linens, and the house of Pratesi was born. The first Pratesi boutique opened in the seaside town of Forte dei Marmi, overlooking the Tyrrhenian Sea off the coast of Tuscany. By 1945, a flagship store was established in Milan on the prestigious via Montenapoleone, before expanding worldwide.

***The Role – Sales & Design Consultant***

Whether you’re greeting clients for the first time in store or by phone, you'll take time to listen to their needs and inspire them by talking passionately about the Pratesi brand, product offering and what makes us unique.

You’ll understand the client’s interior décor needs and help them achieve their aspirations, guaranteeing the sale by attending to every detail and placing customer satisfaction as your priority. At Pratesi, we all have one thing in common, a determination to provide the best possible solutions for our customers.

As a Sales & Design Consultant, you will represent the brand as a Pratesi Ambassador by promoting the values and ambitions of the brand. To do so, you’ll need to focus on the brand's DNA, and understand the brands' vision, purpose, and core values.

***Team Structure***

You’ll be working as part of a small team of Sales & Design Consultants, led by your Shop Manager; however, it’s a place where we’ll ask for your ideas, listen to your opinions and value the contributions you make. You’ll be an integral part of the wider Sferra organization and growing companywith plenty of opportunities for progression.

***Role Responsibilities***

· Managing the end-to-end sales journey for clients, putting their needs at the forefront to ensure they attain the home interiors of their dreams.

· Make sure your store is known locally, use creative ways to build awareness of the brand and exemplary service you offer.

· Providing high levels of customer service in the store at all times.

· Assisting with the Interior Design needs of both retail and trade clients

· Actively outreach to the local Interior Design and Trade community on a regular basis

* Build and maintain client base through consistent follow-up with phone calls and thank you notes, scheduling appointments to review new product lines, and inviting to store events
* Exceptional sales and client relationship building skills in a trade or retail environment. Network with designers, decorators, stylists and commercial developers

· Ability to identify and understand business opportunities and build long term relationships with clients.

· Meet with Interior designers, stylists and commercial developers, ensuring they visit the store and endorse the company’s products in their projects.

· Educate every client about our brand, its USP’s, our products, their features, advantages, and benefits.

· Benchmark the competition and be able to build value in our products for the client.

· Understand the needs of the clients, helping them visualize their luxury interior and suggest solutions that meet those needs, increasing perceived value and the desire to purchase.

· Focus on providing a consultative sales approach with clients of all levels.

· Work in collaboration with the wider Pratesi teams to understand and proactively improve any issues relating to customer experience and drive improvements in our end-to-end process.

* Ensure store presentation is always reflective of the high quality and design levels of our products.
* Demonstrate initiative, enthusiasm, “can do” attitude and passion for our product range.
* Ensure that all your activities are carried out in line with company procedures, processes, and values.

· Enjoy what you do, share this enjoyment with others and be a positive role model for all your colleagues.

· Be an ongoing student of the luxury linen world.

* All other duties as assigned

***Role Expectations***

· Ensure all client quotes, sales and orders are processed efficiently

· Work to achieve required targets of key measurables including sales, average transaction value and conversion rate.

· Actively pursue and achieve client satisfaction survey scores of a minimum of 80% positive reviews (Google 4 stars and above)

* Meet and exceed your personal development KPIs

· Complete your ongoing agreed monthly development goals

· Consistently complete all POS Client marketing fields during the sales process

· Be skilled at upselling, building average transaction value and perceived value and increasing store conversion rate.

***Selection Criteria*** 

· Proven track record, 3 years minimum, in Retail sales is essential ideally within luxury home interiors

· Experience working with Trade, specifically Interior Designers and Stylists and having an establish network is strongly preferred

· Excellent communication skills.

· Self-motivated with an entrepreneurial spirit

· Friendly and confident

· Drive and enthusiasm

· Has built lasting relations with clients, following up effectively and consistently

· Experience and exposure to lifestyle selling rather than product selling, solution-based approach

Flexibility to work a retail schedule which may include evenings, weekends and holidays.

***\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\* While we may not have an immediate opening for this role, we are always on the lookout for talented individuals who align with our mission and values. By submitting your application, you will become part of our talent pipeline, and we'll reach out when a suitable position becomes available.***

***We encourage you to apply now so that we can connect when the right opportunity arises. Your application will be kept on file, and we'll reach out if your background aligns with our future needs.***

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $16.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Weekends as needed

Ability to Relocate:

* New York, NY 10022: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Night Audit Supervisor - Marriott Stamford Hotel & Spa
description:
Meyer Jabara Hotels has distinguished itself as an employer of choice, attracting innovative and talented industry professionals who deliver exceptional results. Our Associates are encouraged to reach their fullest potential by delivering a differentiated experience to our guests and an exceptional bottom-line.
  
  

Night Audit Supervisor - Marriott Stamford Hotel & Spa
  
  

The Stamford Marriott Hotel & Spa located in the heart of bustling downtown Stamford is looking for you! Do you have what it takes to be a successful Night Audit Supervisor at Stamford's number one hotel? Apply now and find out! We'd love to meet you!
  
  

POSITION SUMMARY
  
  

Shift hours are 11pm to 7am. Candidate is required to act as Night Manager any day of the week including public holidays.
  
  

Complete designated cashier and closing reports in the computer system.
  
  

Completion of Daily Revenue Reports nightly to break out the day's revenue accurately for management and ownership.
  
  

Review shift logs/daily memo books and document pertinent information in logbooks.
  
  

Contact appropriate individual or department (e.g., Front Office, Housekeeping) as necessary to resolve guest call, request, or problem.
  
  

Process all guest check-ins by confirming reservations in computer system, verifying guest identity, requesting form of payment, assigning room, and activating and issuing room key.
  
  

Sell a room/accommodation to guests without reservations based on availability.
  
  

Ensure rates match market codes and that any exceptions are documented.
  
  

Ensure checks that come from outlets (e.g., Restaurant, Health Club, Retail Shop) are scanned and charged to room.
  
  

QUALIFICATIONS
  
  

Must possess basic computer skills, i.e., Microsoft Word and Excel, Internet Explorer, etc.
  
  

High school diploma or equivalent required
  
  

Minimum of 2 years experience in a similar position in a full-service hotel.
  
  

Prior experience in Marriott Hotels or full-service hotel brand will be helpful.
  
  

Follow all company and safety and security policies and procedures; report maintenance problems, safety hazards, accidents, or injuries; and complete safety training and certifications. Ensure uniform and personal appearance are clean and professional, maintain confidentiality of proprietary information, and protect company assets. Welcome and acknowledge all guests according to company standards, anticipate and address guests’ service needs, and assist individuals with disabilities. Develop and maintain positive working relationships with all associates and listen and respond appropriately to the concerns of all. Ensure adherence to quality expectations and standards of Stamford Marriott.Reach overhead and below the knees, including bending, twisting, pulling, and stooping. Visually inspect tools, equipment, or machines. Move, lift, carry, push, pull, and place objects weighing less than or equal to 50 pounds without
  
  

The difference between being a good business and an amazing business can be found in the company's footprints made by giving back and serving others. Community relationships matter to the team at Meyer Jabara.

or
  
  

6 years line level experience in all aspects of the Housekeeping Department;
  
or equivalent level of education and experience.
  
  

Prior experience in Marriott Hotels or full-service hotel brand will be helpful.
  
  

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
  
  

Manage daily Housekeeping operations to include, but not limited to, maintaining cleanliness, service and product quality standards of guest rooms, public spaces, restrooms, offices and banquet/meeting/conference rooms.
  
  

Obtains list of vacant rooms to be cleaned immediately and list of prospective checkouts in order to prepare work assignments. Advise Front Office Manager, Guest Service Agents of room ready for occupancy.
  
  

Assigns Housekeeping Attendants their duties and inspects work for conformance to prescribed standards of cleanliness.
  
  

Ensure that all team members follow safety rules and procedures. Take corrective action where required to improve safety of work areas.
  
  

Manage Marriott Housekeeping systems and procedures, cost controls and overall profitability, budgeting and forecasting, department management, Housekeeping standards implementation.
  
  

Inspecting rooms, corridors and lobby, meeting and banquet rooms to determine need for repairs or replacement of furniture or equipment and makes recommendations to management.
  
  

Ensures guestrooms are properly secured and that proper key control procedures are utilized by the housekeeping associates.
  
  

Responsible for smooth function of the hotel laundry operation.
  
  

Assist in monitoring and developing team members performance to include but not limited to providing supervision, conducting counseling and evaluations and delivering recognition and reward.
  
  

Conducts departmental orientation training for new associates and explains Stamford Marriott policies, housekeeping work procedures and to demonstrate use and maintenance of equipment.
  
  

Records date concerning work assignments, personnel actions, timesheet, and prepares periodic reports. Also prepare reports concerning occupancy, payroll expenses and department expenses.
  
  

Assists in controlling expenses of the Housekeeping Department.
  
  

This position reports to the Executive Housekeeper/Director Housekeeping.
  
  

Other duties assigned.
  
  

Follow all company and safety and security policies and procedures; report maintenance problems, safety hazards, accidents, or injuries; and complete safety training and certifications. Ensure uniform and personal appearance are clean and professional, maintain confidentiality of proprietary information, and protect company assets. Welcome and acknowledge all guests according to company standards, anticipate and address guests’ service needs, and assist individuals with disabilities. Develop and maintain positive working relationships with all associates and listen and respond appropriately to the concerns of all. Ensure adherence to quality expectations and standards of Stamford Marriott. Reach overhead and below the knees, including bending, twisting, pulling, and stooping. Visually inspect tools, equipment, or machines. Move, lift, carry, push, pull, and place objects weighing less than or equal to 50 pounds.
  
  

The difference between being a good business and an amazing business can be found in the company's footprints made by giving back and serving others. Community relationships matter to the team at Meyer Jabara.

title: Support Staff SLS - Norwalk
description:
The vision of Marrakech Inc. is that each person we serve will live and work in the community and be accepted by their neighbors, co-workers, family, friends and acquaintances for their individual qualities and contributions.
  
  

SUMMARY
  
We are looking for staff to provide direct care to persons with developmental and physical disabilities in our Supportive Living Services Program. This person will be responsible for implementing behavior programs and other habilitation programs, and also facilitating and promoting community integration and safety.
  
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
  
* Ensure individuals’ medical health issues are addressed. This may include scheduling doctor’s appointments, providing transportation to appointments, following through on doctor’s orders and communicating all pertinent health issues to supervisor.
* Assist individuals in daily activities including daily hygiene functions.
* Implement behavioral goals, teaching strategies, monitoring procedures, exercise programs and other team recommended programs and procedures.
* Assist in the completion of individual assessments.
* Model positive adult roles in the community
* Foster community belonging through person-centered appropriate activities
* Asks for assistance from co-workers and supervisors when unsure of job duties and refers to program policies and procedures for job clarification.
* Supervises and assists in the preparation of food for individuals following special prescribed diets and food consistency. Implements eating procedures as written, if applicable.
* Overnight awake staff is required to complete hourly safety checks on the individual
* Assis individuals in community integration and improving their overall quality of life.


**REQUIREMENTS:**  

PROFESSIONAL COMPETENCIES
  
* Understanding the nature of human systems: individual, group, organization, community and society, and their major interactions for individuals with developmental disabilities.
* Skill in identifying and selecting natural opportunities which promote growth and goal attainment for individuals with developmental disabilities.
* Skill in implementing interventions for individuals with developmental disabilities.
* Process skills which are required to implement services for individuals with developmental disabilities.


EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE
  
High school diploma or general education degree (GED); 3 to 6 months-related experience and /or training, or human service training certificate.
  
CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS
  
* Valid Connecticut Driver’s License
* Ability to obtain the following licenses/certifications:
* Department of Developmental Services - Medication Certification
* Public Service License valid for the state of Connecticut (if applicable)
* CPR and First Aid certification


**Benefits:**  

* Paid time off (PTO) and Dedicated Sick Time
* Paid Holidays
* New Year’s Day
* Martin Luther King, Jr. Day
* Memorial Day
* Juneteenth
* Independence Day
* Labor Day
* Thanksgiving
* Christmas
* Paid and Unpaid Leave for:
* Bereavement
* Jury Duty
* Disaster Relief Volunteer
* Family and Non-FMLA Medical Leave
* Military Leave
* Employer- Sponsored Medical, Dental, Vision and Life Insurance (for full time employees)
* External Employee Assistance Program (EAP) (for full time employees)
* 401K and Profit Sharing Plan
* Educational Benefits, Including:
* DSP Credentialing through the NADSP
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Tuition discounts at local colleges and universities
* Access to Various Voluntary Insurances and Benefits
* Staff Recognition Program
* Other Financial Benefits, Including but not limited to:
* Dayforce Wallet (On-Demand Pay)
* Marrakech’s Homeownership Program
* Perfect Attendance Bonus Program
* Recruitment Referral Bonus
* Other Corporate Discount Programs


Marrakech is an equal opportunity employer. Marrakech, Inc. does not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, color, religion, age, disability, status of veteran, national or ethnic origin, or sexual orientation.

title: Grocery Merchandiser
description:
Part-time work as a grocery merchandiser - great for those looking for supplemental income, retired or looking to rejoin the workforce.

Our company has openings in the Short Hills, NJ area as a PART-TIME merchandiser in grocery stores working with frozen and refrigerated products.

**MAXIMUM Total Hours Per Week = 6 Hour/Visit Per Week**

*Responsibilities:*

* Restocking products
* Overall maintenance and care of unit
* Regular cleaning and defrosting of unit
* Hanging signage
* Public Relations - develop and maintain positive relationships with ALL store personnel

*Hours/Pay Structure:*

* Visits are once weekly to each store - 'visit days' are specified based on retailer and predetermined
* YOU choose time of day to visit
* Time in-store ranges from 15 minutes to 45 minutes
* Payment is 'per visit' - not 'per hour' - $16/visit (aka $16/hour, even if under an hour)
* W2 Employment - NOT Independent Contractor(1099/IC) position
* Starting Pay is $16/Visit
* Travel/mileage/gas reimbursement is NOT paid - this is not negotiable.

*Requirements:*

* Self-motivated
* Well organized
* Enjoy working independently
* Reliable transportation - a VEHICLE is required for this position
* Clean driving record
* Retail, route driving or merchandising experience

NOT AVAILABLE TO THOSE SEEKING FULL-TIME EMPLOYMENT!

* Choose your own hours
* No weekends

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: From $16.00 per hour

Expected hours: 6 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Schedule:

* Choose your own hours
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday
* No nights
* No weekends

Work Location: In person
company_description: J.R. Demos & Merchandising is a nationwide, field service agency specializing in staffing merchandising projects, mystery shops and promotional events, including in-store demonstrations/sampling.

title: Plumbing foreman
description:
A Plumbing foreman supervises journeyman plumbers and helpers. Performs and oversees plumbing functions including installation of pipes, fittings, and fixtures of heating, water and drainage systems. Ensures all work is performed as per specifications and plumbing codes, studies the plans and drawings to determine work aids required. Provides input in plans developments and executes accodingly.

**Responsibilities:**  
- Supervise and manage plumbing projects from start to finish, ensuring adherence to project timelines and budgets.

- Collaborate with PM and subcontractors to develop project plans and schedules.

- Utilize construction management software to create project schedules, RFI and CO.

- Implement and enforce OSHA regulations and safety protocols on job sites.

- Conduct regular site visits to monitor progress, resolve any issues, and ensure compliance with project specifications/deadlines.

- Coordinate with Purchasing to ensure timely delivery of materials and equipment.

- Oversee quality control measures to ensure that work meets industry standards and client expectations.

- Review and interpret schematics, blueprints, and other technical documents.

- Performs pipe threading and soldering.

- Attends job site meetings and conducts toolbox meeting with his team.

- Performs tests to ensure systems have no leaks and all systems working properly.

- Schedules and attends inspections with local authorities and utilities.

- Supervises all phases of plumbing .

**Skills:**  
- Strong knowledge of Plumbing techniques and practices

- Familiarity with OSHA regulations and safety protocols

- Excellent supervisory skills with the ability to manage a team effectively

- Strong organizational and time management abilities

- OSHA and Driver's license required\\*

- Open and positive communication individually as well as in a team enviroment.

- Attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality work

- Able to read blueprints and interpret drawings.

- 5+ years of experience in supervisory role

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $30.00 - $37.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* supervisory: 5 years (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Elizabeth, NJ (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Afterschool Teacher & Assistant Teacher
description:

a) Associate’s degree in Child Development , Elementary Education ,

Physical Education, Recreation or a related field and 2 years of direct

experience working with children under 13 years age, including at

least one year in a supervisory capacity in a child care program or

related field of work.

years of direct experience working with children under 13 years of age,

including at least one year in a supervisory capacity in a child care

program or related field of work.

c) School-Age Child Care Credential or other Office –recognized

credential specific to the school-age developmental period; and 2

years of direct experience working with children under 13 years of age

including at least one year in a supervisory capacity in a child care

program or related field of work .

d) 2 years of college with 18 credits in Child Development, Elementary

Education, Physical Education, Recreation or a related field; and 2

years of direct experience working with children under 13 years of age

including at least one year in a supervisory capacity in a child care

program or related field of work.

```Duties```  
- Develop and implement lesson plans that fulfill the requirements of the school's curriculum program  
- Create a positive and engaging learning environment for students  
- Provide instruction in various subjects, such as math, science, language arts, and social studies  
- Use effective teaching strategies to accommodate different learning styles and abilities  
- Assess student performance and provide feedback on their progress  
- Collaborate with other teachers and staff to create a cohesive educational experience  
- Maintain accurate records of student attendance, grades, and behavior  
- Communicate with parents/guardians regarding student progress and any concerns  
- Participate in professional development opportunities to enhance teaching skills

```Experience```  
- Strong classroom management skills  
- Ability to provide tutoring or additional support to students as needed

Requirement : Fluent in English (Chinese is preferred)

Please note that this job description is not exhaustive and may be subject to change.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $16.00 - $30.00 per hour

Expected hours: 17 per week

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Ability to Relocate:

* Brooklyn, NY 11219: Relocate before starting work (Required)
